column1: M. Tresca has lately presented to the Academy of Sciences some very interesting experiments on the development and distribution of heat produced by a blow of the steam hammer in the process of forging. The method used was as follows: The bar was carefully polished on both sides
column2: and this polished part covered with a thin layer of wax. It was then placed on an anvil and struck by a monkey of known weight
column5: H. The faces of the monkey and anvil were exactly alike
column6: and care was taken that the whole work
column8: should be expended upon the bar. A single blow was enough to melt the wax over a certain zone; and this indicated clearly how much of the lateral faces had been raised by the shock to the temperature of melting wax.
